title: sri lanka easter massacre bombing religion jane moore
story: Yet, just seconds later, a suicide bomber stepped in to the church in Sri Lanka and wreaked his unholy evil on all those congregated there.As relatives later wailed with grief next to Sneha’s coffin, her grandmother asked: “There are so many bad people in the world. Why kill the innocents ”An obvious question from all right-minded people. But when you’re a murdering psycho, you want to wreak terror not just on those present, but in the minds of millions around the world.And the way they do that is to target innocent people in the normal, everyday scenarios we can all identy with.Attending a church or mosque with family and friends, taking our kids to a concert or a busy shopping mall at the weekend, cheering on marathon runners, queuing for breakfast at a holiday hotel . . .Who among us has not read about Sneha and her friends . . .  or the heartbreaking stories of the British father who lost his we and two children . . . or the Danish man who lost three of his four children . . . and thought of how we would copefaced with the same situation That’s terrorism. It projects fear on to the masses and seeks to make us alter our behaviour accordingly.With every fibre of my being, I want to resist the power of this pernicious tactic, but of late I’ll admit I have struggled.On Friday night, our -year-old attended a Shawn Mendes concert at London’s O arena with a friend and her mother. We wrestled with whether to let her go or not, then felt anxious from the moment she set off until she ed home.Equally, when she expressed a wish to meet her friends at a vast mall last week, we urged her to give it a miss and browse the shops locally. Irrational, yes, but that’s what terrorism can do to your mindsetyou let it.You don’t want to be that grieving family, so you try to minimise the chances of it happening.The truth, of course, is thata suicide bomber decides to board your train carriage, or walk in to your community centre, or drive a car that blows up just as you’re walking past — there’s not a damn thing you can do about it.But what we can do is stand together in our firm belief that these attacks — be it on churches or mosques — have nothing to do with religion.Just hours after the coordinated bombings in his country, the Sri Lankan minister of state for defence said preliminary investigations have shown, “this attack was carried out in retaliation for the attack against Muslims in Christchurch [New Zealand]”.Meanwhile, reports have emerged of young Christian men walking the streets near Sneha’s home of Negombo carrying long sticks and “looking for Muslims”.Again, this us-against-them mindset is what terrorism seeks to inflame.But this isn’t about Christianity versus Islam.The attacks in Sri Lanka, New Zealand, Manchester and London — to name but a few — are the actions of a warped few who have distorted the teachings of wholly peaceful religions to suit their own, murderous ends.We mustn’t allow one drop of poison to contaminate an ocean of humanity.DR GAIL BRADBROOK is the co-founder of Extinction Rebellion, the eco action group that brought central London to a virtual standstill last week.She says: “I think our protests have been awesome.“We’re making history at the minute, people are having a fantastic time on the streets and we really welcome people to come join us.”Yes, I’m sure workers on zero hours contracts would relish the opportunity to lose a day’s payto join her, so too the nurses whose arrival at nearby St Thomas’ hospital each day is critical to the wellbeing of thousands of patients.Dr Bradbrook may have a PhD in molecular biophysics but one fears she and her merry band of protestors may have skipped lessons in common sense.Why  would they glue themselves to public transport that encourages people to leave their cars at home while simultaneously causing air polluting traffic jams And why  would they stage a sit-in aimed to make the politicians take notice when the House of Commons rose on April  for recess and didn’tuntil yesterday  Duh.The majority of the population supports action on climate change, but this virtue-signalling nonsense only detracts from the cause by irritating ordinary people just tryingto earn a living. Begging the question: Why only now HOLLYWOOD star Anne Hathaway says she’s giving up alcohol until her son is .She’s a stronger woman than me.Meanwhile, she has also abandoned veganism after admitting that she “just didn’t feel good or healthy”. She says she immediately felt betterafter eating a fish dish from Iceland.I know what you’re thinking . . . was it the £ prawn ring as advertised by Kerry Katona No, Anne’s le-changing fish experience was a sustainably sourced salmon at a Michelin-starred restaurant in Reykjavik.Easy mistake to make though.“HEALTH tourism” is still an ongoing issue, with reports that ten people a day are jetting to the UK to have their babies delivered on the NHS.The bill for caring for , foreign maternity cases was around £.million in  , with only £.million of it clawed back.Meanwhile, three-year-old Victoria Komada, from Norwich, was born with twisted legs and faced a double amputation.And thanks only to the generosity of the local community in Norwich and those in Poland’s Szczecin, where her parents grew up, £, was raised for her to fly toFlorida for an operation to help her walk. Each week we see the plight of desperate people trying to raise money for treatments the NHS won’t fund.Just think of how many of them that unrecouped £.million might have helped.Some days, it feels like we in the UK have  of them.CERTAIN IVF clinics are exploiting older women whose chances of having a baby are very poor, the fertility regulator has warned.Since , the number of -plus women having IVF has doubled, with some clinics “trading on hope” despite a success rate of just one per cent for a woman of  using her own eggs.A spokeswoman for the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Authoritysaid she would like these clinics to be honest about the low statistics.She’s right, but one suspects the number of older women opting for IVF will remain high.Because when you’re desperate for a child, even in a fertility lottery of just one per cent, there still lies the hope that it could be you.Fast forward years and they’re still performing though, despite a healthy diet and regular exercise, the batteries are running noticeably lower. Particularly as there’s now only three of them on stage.Howard,  this weekend, is a former breakdancer and perhaps the fittest of them all.But while his body is making all the right moves, his face is positively screaming: “Is there much more of this  Line Of Duty’s on in a minute.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: dad giant hernias pregnant surgery
story: Mark Webb lost seven stone in less than  months as the tears in his stomach have left him unable to eat without vomiting.The -year-old, from Bodmin, Cornwall, says hes been fighting for le while waiting for surgery to repair the hernias.He told The Sun Online: “People call me pregnant and it’s clear to see why - I look like I’m carrying a baby under my top.It’s actually five protruding hernias in my stomach creating a large mass, which my we Maria and I refer to as my bump.“I know it sounds funny and I know people don’t actually mean any harm when they say I look pregnant, but living this way is absolute hell.I have been waiting for a hernia operation for almost two years and despite my health problem not being seen as an emergency, the longer I wait the more my health is deteriorating.I have come very close to dying on more than one occasion and I can’t bear the thought of leaving my family.”Mark’s we Maria Webb, , finds it heartbreaking to watch her husband go through such an ordeal.She said: “Mark is literally disappearing in front of my eyes.He has lost seven stone in less than  months due to not be able to eat without vomiting – and he’s ft in so he looks very drawn for his size.“He has been in hospital three times in the last three weeks because of all of this and because the doctors were so concerned for his health, but he has still not been given the operation he so badly needs.If he doesn’t have it soon the kids will end up being left without a dad.”Maria added: It wasn’t long ago that after Mark had been discharged from hospital, I found him half-dead slouched on the sofa.He had been throwing up all night and was struggling to breathe. When I called the ambulance, the paramedics couldn’t believe he had been allowed home in that state.If I hadn’t have called for help that morning, he’d be dead.’Mark, who has been suffering with hernias for more than ten years, has had numerous operations to repair them in the past and also had to have a testicle removed due to an error during one operation.The dad has been passed from doctor to doctor and was told by one to lose weight - but nothing close to the seven stone he has lost without even trying.Maria said: “It really affects Mark because people are always staring at him.He regularly gets strange looks and negative comments too, which is upsetting – mainly about him being pregnant and asking when’s it due.“He wore his coat most of last summer to cover his bump, even though it was boiling hot. It’s not right.A hernia occurs when an internal part of the body pushes through a weakness in the muscle or surrounding tissue wall.It usually develops between your chest and hips.In many cases, it causes no or very few symptoms, although you may notice a swelling or lump in your tummyor groin.The lump can often be pushed back in or disappears when you lie down.Coughing or straining may make the lump appear.There are several dferent types of hernias inguinal femoral umbilical hiatus and other less common types.See your GPyou think you have a hernia. They may refer you to hospital for surgical treatment,necessary.You should go the accident and emergency  department of your nearest hospital immediatelyyou have a hernia and you develop any of the following symptoms:These symptoms could mean the hernia has started to cut off blood supply to an organ or surrounding tissue, or a piece of the bowel has entered the hernia.Source: NHS I have to buy him the baggiest jumpers I can find and even those don’t go over his bump properly.“It also affects our children. Mark can’t physically pick up the youngest or be active with any of them.“Mark used to love swimming with the kids, but he had to stop last year.There’s no way he can physically swim anymore and evenhe could, he would be too embarrassed for people to see his hernias at the pool.“He gets unwell and weak just walking across the living room and the hernias cause him a pain very similar to contractions in labour.He can be walking down the street and have to stop while his hernias cramp up.The couple’s children, aged , , , , five and two, worry about their father’s health.Maria said: “Our youngest child wakes up in the night panicking about his daddy and he is always asking where he is andhe’s okay.“It makes me sad that all of our kids have to see their dad as a frail -year-old man.They see him fighting for his le, see him being rushed to hospital and see the ambulances that come and go.They don’t knoweach day will be the last they will see him. Mark turns  this month but there is no way we can celebrate when he’s so unwell.”Mark, who has to take strong painkillers including morphine every day, has been ruled unfit to work.He said: “All I want is for this to be dealt with so I can get on with my le and work again, so I can give my we and children what they deserve - they are feeling this just as much as myself.Back in January , Mark had to have a hernia repaired in his stomach but unfortunately by May it had ed.He was referred back to a consultant and eventually seen in October, only to be told it was too complicated and he would have to be referred to someone .In April , Mark saw another doctor who told him the surgery for his hernia would be extremely dangerous.Mark said: “That’s when I was advised to lose kg and was told the doctor would see me again in  weeks.During this time two more hernias appeared and my stomach became very large.”In January this year, Mark still hadn’t heard anything, so he contacted his doctor’s secretary only to be told his doctor hadn’t been working for months and it was uncertain when he would be ing,at all.“I was then forgotten to be referred to someone,” said Mark.“In the meantime I lost seven stone in less than  months because I struggle to eat and can’t keep food down when I do.”Mark has previously worn a hernia belt to try and hold the hernias in, but it now falls off him because of his signicant weight loss.Last week, he received a letter with an appointment to see another consultant next month, to discuss the best course of action with regards to an operation.Mark said: “I just really want all this to be dealt with so I can get on with my le and so we can be a normal family again.I want to feel like myself again instead of feeling abnormal.This has gone on for far too long.”

title: james glancy brexit party voters feel ignored
story: But our greatest asset — our free and tolerant democracy — is under threat.The failure of our politicians to listen to the people — and their complete lack of leadership — has compelled me to take a stand.I am standing for the Brexit Party on the single issue of democracy. We have assembled a erse group of candidates from across the political spectrum, from former Tory Ann Widdecombe to left-wing grandee Claire Fox.We are all unied in our desire to pressure Westminster to deliver what the people instructed.It is vital we restore parliamentary democracy. Through my service with the Royal Marines and the Special Boat Service, I witnessed the Arab Spring first-hand and saw the horrors suffered by a people with no representation in their political system.I never thought our political class would deliberately undermine the people.But they have done so by failing to deliver on the  referendum. This after the  General Election manestos of the Conservative and Labour parties clearly pledged to honour the result.Voters on all sides have been betrayed. The final straw for me was seeing the men who sent me to a questionable war in Afghanistan — Tony Blair, Lord Adonis and Alastair Campbell — conspiring to undermine the people.They have been colluding with other governments in Europe to stop Brexit.It is vital we stand up against the damage this hardcore group who want to create an EU super-state are inflicting on British democracy.It is deeply saddening to see the isions across our country. People voted to Remain and Leave for a range of legitimate reasons.We are in this position due to John Major and Tony Blair’s arrogance in not consulting thepeople on the treaties that embedded us in the EU — Maastricht, Amsterdam, Nice and Lisbon.The public should have been consulted on these major transfers of power from Parliament towards the supranational structures of the EU.We are now left with this political mess as their legacy.One of the greatest testaments to Britain is that so many people are willing to take huge risks to come and live here, to be free and prosperous.My ancestors came to the UK from Ireland in the th century to escape famine and persecution. They settled in Greenock in the Scottish Lowlands.I am deeply disturbed that Brexit has now come to focus on identity and immigration, instead of on democracy and who runs our country.We should celebrate immigrants as the heroes who want to be British and part of the national ­success story. Brexit is not a right-wing project. Five million Labour voters and a third of ethnic-minority voters backed Leave.Yet from some of the rhetoric spouted, you would think that Brexit voters are all ignorant racists.  The result is that the Leave voters feel patronised, insulted and ignored. Look at the  Labour MPs — many of whom represent Leave-voting constituencies — who voted for a second referendum to overturn the first.The contempt they show for the ordinary people who put their faith in the democratic process is breathtaking.If politicians fail to deliver the result of the referendum, they will be guilty of selling out the people and undermining Britain’s international credibility as a stable and free liberal democracy.The backlash from the public would be unthinkable.Beyond Brexit, I see an opportunity to implement the strongest animal welfare and environmental legislation in the world. It is a chance to reset our relationship with nature, away from the Common Agricultural Policy.I strongly disagree with those who want to weaken environmental policy.Yet the beauty of an accountable liberal democracy is that those decisions can be made in our own Parliament.A vote for the Brexit Party will send shockwaves across Westminster, reminding them that the people are in charge.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: cannot ignore our allies for superfast
story: America, Australia and New Zealand have barred China’s Huawei from being involved in theirs. Canada may do too.That would leave us out on a limb among the “Five Eyes” intelligence ­alliance in ignoring fears that a tech giant so close to the Chinese state could be used for spying.Theresa May was rightly worried about China’s investment in the Hinkley Point nuclear plant, let alone a vast new communications system.She has had assurances from our spy chiefs that any threat can be contained. Fair enough. But is it worth spooking our closest friends in the world  Their fears are not groundless. The PM and GCHQ will need to convince them too.Mrs May must decide fast, though.The price of being left behind over G will be huge.GRETA Thunberg is in some ways an admirable child: Bright, engaged, passionate about her cause and inspiring to other kids.What troubles us are the credulous adults fawning over her.In Greta’s black-and-white view, climate change is frying the planet while wicked corporations cash in and lazy governments “don’t listen to the science”.It’s simplistic nonsense. Governments try to balance tough environmental action with keeping people in jobs and families fed. The general strike Greta demands — or the end of air travel — would bring only chaos and hardship.Britain is a world leader in emissions reduction. So why are Greta and her aides here lecturing us instead of China, India or the US  Simple. Most journalists won’t interrogate a girl of  over her well-meaning naivety.But our endless supply of vacuous, needy politicians WILL indulge her.And the grandstanding Commons Speaker John Bercow will welcome her to Parliament like she was Nelson Mandela instead of a wide-eyed kid too young to vote.IMAGINEnewspapers gave terrorists a  to stoke violence.Or, immediately after a mass suicide bombing, they spread  conspiracy theories guaranteed to inflame tensions.Or , weeks after a massacre, their websites still streamed horric first-person footage filmed by the gunman.Imagine, too,they provided a  for baseless scaremongering alleging the dangers of routine childhood vaccinations, and the worldwide death rate from measles then soared.Those papers would rightly face massive penalties. Yet social media giants get away with feebly protesting that they can still police themselves.The long-term answer must be effective regulation, as it is for any other publisher.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: easyjet brit holidaymakers door panic
story: Passengers and crew forced the man to the floor of the easyJet plane when he yanked twice at the handle after leaving the loo.The man, in his s, was bundled into a seat and “boxed in” by other male travellers as the Airbus A, which set off from Gatwick, finished its descent into Pisa in Italy.Company boss Richard Conyard, , said: “I saw this bloke walk up the aisle behind me and head towards the toilet.“He looked a little nervous and had a heavy coat on. He was in the toilet for about a minute.“When he came out he went towards the emergency exit and grabbed the handle and tried to open the door.“One of the crew screamed at him to stop and other passengers started shouting and crying. Everyone was understandably very scared.“A couple of guys went to help. I joined them. We bundled him into a seat. Some women nearby were asked to swap seats so all these burly blokes could sit around him and box him in.”Richard, of Maidstone, Kent, added: “He just sat there until we landed. We had to stay in our seats until police arrived.”Experts said thatthe door had opened the sudden decompression could have seen passengers sucked out and the cabin temperature plummet dangerously low.EasyJet said: “The captain of Flight EZY from London Gatwick to Pisa requested police to meet the aircraft due to the disruptive behaviour of a passenger onboard during the descent.”It said that cabin crew were trained to act fast to ensure the safety of the flight and passengers.Pisa Airport cops said a man in his s from Siena in Italy had been quizzed in connection with Wednesday’s drama.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: barratt homes mould plymouth devon
story: Retired shop manager Jean Martin, ,  is heading a group of residents who bought new-builds they say are already disintegrating - estimating the cost to be £, for each home to put the damage right.The residents claim the developer, Barratt Homes, has said there is nothing they can do as the £, houses are out of warranty.Now, Jean, from Plymouth, Devon, has set up a petition with other residents demanding action is taken.She said: Weve got red streaks coming through the outside paintwork and black blotches appearing through the outside paintwork.In addition, rendering breaking up around the windows.Weve been here for six years. Other properties built ten months before ours are in an even worse condition.You wouldnt believe that these houses, government funded, are so new. It looks like mould is coming through the black parts of the property.We had a builder around, who said that the only way we would be able to get rid of it is to strip the rendering right back down, and re-rendering it.We wouldnt get a penny out of £,.Jean said the National House Building Council told her that the warranty does not cover this particular issue, while Plymouth Community Homes could not help either.She continued: Were going around in circles and having absolutely no joy whatsoever, with nobody taking ownership, for which I am astounded.Barratt Homes say the issue is out of warranty, the NHBC advise that we are under a ten-year warranty which doesnt cover this problem.Then Plymouth Community Homes advise they have no idea how to get rid of the issues.The properties are relatively new and we take pride in our properties and do not appreciate having this to the exterior, which is obviously caused by shoddy workmanship in the mix.There is no other explanation.Mrs Martin and a number of her neighbours are going to petition for action to be taken.Someone must be able to look at these cases and act appropriately, she said. We are going to take this to our MP to see what can be done. title: port talbot steelworks blast tata
story: Two people were injured when the deafening blast unfolded at Tata Steelworks in the South Wales town - waking terried locals at around .am.Footage shows the moment of the explosion, with the bright light engulfing the town.South Wales Police said that at least two people were injured after a spillage of liquid iron when it was travelling to the steel plant.Early indications suggest the explosion was sparked by a train used to carry molten metal, the force said.Eyewitness Lance Davies lives at the highest point in the town and said it was a miracle no-one was killed.He said: I was woken up this morning by what sounded like thunder, I went to the window and could see the results of the first explosion, then I called my partner and saw the other two.That was all you could see, it was like a scene from Independence Day. Once it was over, I did wonder what it was and just did think about the works.Were just all relieved that there are no fatalities.Unite union representative Stephen Davies said the two workers injured in the incident suffered superficial burns, one to the back of the head and another to his chest, and have now been released from hospital.An investigation into the explosion has since been launched.Did you witness the explosion  Email us at tips@the-sun or call   . You can WhatsApp us on   .A South Wales Police spokeswoman said: Emergency services remain on scene but we have had confirmation that all members of staff are accounted for and there are only two casualties with minor injuries.Early indications are that the seat of the explosion was a train which carries molten metal into the works.The explosion caused some small fires which are all under control and damage to some buildings on the site.South West Fire and Rescue Service have informed us there is no need for concerns re hazardous effects from the smoke from the fire.Local Twitter user Laura Morris wrote: I hope from whatever has happened at the Steel Works Port Talbot, that everyone is ok. #ApocolypticScenes.Others reported their homes shaking violently with the force of the explosions.One witness told Good Morning Britain they heard three explosions, saying: The actual house shook.Twitter user @Buff wrote: There was just a big explosion from port Talbot steelworks that just shook the house, hoping no one was hurt.Another resident said: Huge explosion in Port Talbot just woke me up, the house shook for a good while and I actually thought it was an earthquake again, s**t myself!And a fourth wrote: I swear something just blew up in port Talbot.  huge bangs and the pressure blew my bedroom door open.A spokesman for Tata said the incident involved a spillage of molten iron.They said: Two of our employees suffered minor injuries and both have been released following treatment.The spillage led to a number of fires which were extinguished by our own emergency services supported by members of the Mid and West Wales Fire and Rescue Service. Police and ambulance also attended.We are currently investigating the cause of the incident and are looking to minimise any impact on production.Aberavon MP Stephen Kinnock said the incident raised real concerns about safety at the works.He said: It could have been a lot worse. title: creepy sushi spider found in mans home leaves internet users baffled
story: William Williamson, from Sydney, Australia, posted a photo of the odd looking critter on a local community Facebook group in the hope someone could identy it.People were quick to point out the spider looked like a tiny piece of sushi, complete with rice, avocado and fish eggs.The majority of social media users claimed they had never seen anything like it before.One person said: At first glance I thought this was a piece of sushi.Another said: Is this what Easter bunny or dog spat out  Yuk.”One user was completely horried by the eight-legged find, urging Mr Williamson to “burn the house down”.The mysterious spider was eventually identied as an Ordgarius magnicus, more commonly known as the magnicent spider.These spiders are found on Australia’s east coast and, thankfully, pose no threat to humans.A fully grown female can reach up to .cm, according to the Australian Museum.Unlike many spiders who build webs, the magnicent spider has a more sophisticated way of catching its prey.It uses a single line of sticky silk that has a globule attached to one end that mimics the scent of a particular type of female moth.The smell attracts the male moths and they become trapped in the silk.These spiders usually hang out in the garden and are great at keeping pests under control.A version of this article was originally published on news.au.

title: gonorrhoea increase cases sti signs
story: The number of people with the sexually transmitted infection went up by  per cent across Europe in .It follows a decline in cases in the previous year, according to the latest figures from the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control .With , confirmed cases between  and , Gonorrhoea - also known as the clap - is now the second most common STI in Europe after chlamydia.Gianfranco Spiteri, of the ECDC, said: One thing the constantly high rate of reported gonorrhoea cases in Europe tells us, is that people keep having sex with new and casual partners without condoms.Which makes it easy to pass on an infection that is increasingly resistant to the common antibiotic treatment options.The increase follows an overall trend over the last decade in which  of the  EU countries consistently reported an increase in gonorrhoea cases.Since , France and Portugal experienced a six-fold increase, while Denmark and Ireland now record more than three times as many confirmed cases.Some countries noted striking year-on-year increases of more than  per cent, like Finland and Sweden.More than , Brits were diagnosed with the infection in , while million are infected globally every year, according to the World Health Organisation.Experts found men who have sex with men accounted for almost half of the gonorrhoea cases in .They added that the rise in cases among women is concerning as untreated gonorrhoea can lead to pelvic inflammatory disease or cause infertility.Spiteri added: We have to bear in mind that the numbers we see do not even show the true extent of the gonorrhoea epidemic in Europe.Many infections are not diagnosed due to lack of symptoms or limited access to diagnostics or simply are not reported.If you are at risk, make sure to get tested regularly.Gonorrhoea is a bacterial infection which spreads through all forms of unprotected sex, as well as by sharing unwashed or unprotected sex toys.According to the NHS, the bacteria which causes gonorrhoea can sometimes infect your throat and eyes, as well as the more common locations of the cervix, urethra and rectum.Pregnant women can pass the infection on to their baby, which can cause blindnessit isnt treated in time.The signs of a gonorrhoea infection can y between men and women.In women, symptoms can often include unusually watery or off-colour vaginal discharge, as well as burning pain when urinating.Less common symptoms in women include pain in the lower gut and bleeding between periods or after sex.In men, symptoms can include an unusual discharge from the penis, burning after urinating, swelling in the foreskin and, in rare cases, pain in the testicles.Normally, it takes a couple of weeks from infection for the symptoms to emerge - although it can take a few months longer in some cases.However, around one tenth of men and half of women have the disease without any symptoms, which can mean it goes longer without being treated.

story: The party erupted into a fresh civil war today after the flyers for the upcoming EU polls didnt mention the partys controversial row over another referendum, Huffington Post revealed.The only mention of Brexit at all was on the back, with a few sentences saying: The Tories handling of Brexit has left our country in crisis.Labour will keep a close relationship with the EU and protect workers rights.And it says Britain would have a say in future trade deals - even though experts have cast doubt on that in the event we signed up to a customs union.Even Shadow Brexit Secretary Sir Keir Starmer wasnt consulted on the flyer.A senior shadow ministerial source added: Keir is absolutely furious about the leaflet. He knows very well that it doesn’t reflect the party’s policy, the views of the membership or our candidates. It will have to change.The Labour boss been desperately trying to keep his Remainer members on side while not rejecting MPs and northern voters who opted for Brexit in .After months of deliberations the party finally threw its weight behind another poll - but has made no plans to actually make it happen yet.One senior Labour source told the website: This is clearly a monumental and embarrassing f**k up.One Labour member said it would hand victory to Nigel Farage on a plate by not mentioning a second vote.Plaid MP Jonathan Edwards tweeted earlier: A month before possible European elections and Labour dont know what their policy is on Brexit after three years of janus faced posturing.Labour MP David Lammy earlier demanded that the leaflets be changed.He said: The way we win the European Elections is to offer a bold alternative to Brexit, not to pretend a better deal with Europe is possible.Several MPs and MEPs are signing a letter calling on the leadership to include the guarantee of a second vote in their manesto, which hasnt yet been released.Labours stop National Executive Committee are set to decide on the partys policies for the upcoming EU poll in the coming days.Theresa Mays said she doesnt want Britain to take part, almost three years after Brits voted to leave.Butno Brexit deal is passed by MPs by then, shell have no choice.A Labour spokesman said: “This is a short pre-manesto leaflet to introduce our candidates and set out our commitment to Leave and Remain voters to bring our country together.“It highlights how the Tories’ chaotic handling of Brexit has left our country in crisis and how our MEPs will fight for proper investment in communities, housing, jobs and industries. Our full manesto, which will address the issues of a Brexit deal and the circumstances of a referendum, will be published after the local elections.

title: model looked like shed done
story: NewsModel looked like she’d done  rounds with Mike Tyson after cheap lip fillersGrace Teal, , says her lips became painfully swollen, bruised and lumpy after she agreed to the procedure following a few glasses of proseccoShareCommentsByOliver PritchardAnna Slater:,  APR NewsShe is speaking out to warn others "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A glamour model says she was piled with booze before being given dodgy lip fillers that made her look like sheaposd done  rounds with Mike Tyson. Grace Teal says a newly-qualied beautician offered her and her pals the £ injections after giving them a few glasses of prosecco.Feeling tipsy from the wine and enticed by the prospect of fuller, sexier lips, the -year-old agreed to the treatment.But the end result left her regretting that decision, the Daily Star reports.   Her lips soon became painfully swollen, bruised and lumpy. The mum-of-one said: As the weeks passed by I developed lumps in my lips. “I visited a specialist aesthetics doctor who painfully removed the lumps by stabbing them with a needle and squeezing them out. “This is so uncomfortable, evenyou have numbing cream.”    Grace added: “I have seen so many girls with botched-up fillers it’s scary. I can’t stress enough how important it is to pay that bit more and go to a qualied practitioner with good feedback from customers. “The last thing you want to do is distort your look when you’re aiming to enhance.” Grace spoke as the Department of Health prepares to launch a campaign to ensure the public are fully informed about the importance of seeking professional advice regarding fillers, Botox and cosmetic surgery.

John Rhys-Davies - who played Gimli the dwarf - claimed he had never seen such anger as he made a rare appearance on the flagship BBC debate show. The -year-old Welsh actor faced down Labouraposs Jon Ashworth, Green MP Caroline Lucas and Lib Dem leader Sir Vince Cable as he appeared on the show in Nottingham. But he was branded thuggish and sexist by one prominent campaigner as he lost his temper in one clash with Ms Lucas - and shouted at her: Oh, woman!. At one point he said: “I have never seen such a level of anger. I do believe every member here entered politics in order to the best for their people who elected them, for their constituencies. But your primary objective is to preserve democracy.  And whatever you may feel, you have betrayed democracy. Many audience members applauded enthusiastically as he unleashed his comments against MPs. But he was also branded “thuggish” and “sexist” for shouting “oh, woman!” at Ms Lucas in a separate rant. The actor snapped when the Green MP said Donald Trump does not represent the American people. Slapping his hand down on the desk he replied: “Oh woman! Have you ever read Kenneth Harold and Arrowaposs Theorem   “Any system of election has its problems!” Ms Lucas replied: “And the American one more than most!” Prominent Remain campaigner Femi Oluwole, of the Our Future Our Choice group, tweeted: “Did anyone  feel genuinely worried for Caroline Lucas in this moment  “John Rhys-Davies may sound posh, but that was thuggish behaviour by anyoneaposs definition. ”  It comes amid anger among Brexiteers after the date for leaving the EU was delayed to October . Theresa May has also entered talks with Labour which her hardline Brexiteers believe could lead to a apossofterapos deal. Meanwhile some MPs, include Ms Lucas and Sir Vince, have been campaigning for a second referendum. Rhys-Davies has previously been described as not being a member of any political party. In  he claimed Tony Blair , David Cameron and Gordon Brown were the least qualied men to govern a country that we’ve had in  years. But he was embroiled in an Islamophobia row in  after hardline comments he made about Islam were endorsed by the BNP.  According to Wales Online, he declared he was for deadwhite male culture. He added at the time: There is a demographic catastrophe happening in Europe that nobody wants to talk about, that we darenapost bring up because we are so cagey about not offending people racially. And rightly we should be. But there is a cultural thing as well. By ,  per cent of the children in Holland under the age of  will be of Muslim descent. I think that Tolkien says that some generations will be challenged. Andthey do not rise to meet that challenge, they will lose their civilisation. That does have a real resonance with me. Meanwhile Sir Vince Cable used last nightaposs Question Time to issue a plea for anti-Brexit MPs to work together. He slammed reports that Change UK - which formed from the Independent Group of  defector MPs - is plotting to seize Lib Dem support in the EU elections on May .  Sir Vince said: I would be much happier franklywe pooled our resources and worked together.” Askedhe would refuse to stand candidates against Change UK he said: I had suggested we have that kind of cooperation. It wasn’t feasible within the present voting system and there wasn’t willingness to do it. I am concerned we’re just fragmenting in rather a chaotic way.

On Thursday  May, millions of Brits will go to the polls in the European Parliament elections - two months after we were supposed to leave the EU. The drama around Brexit has encouraged many larger-than-le characters to come out of the woodwork and stand for the  British seats up for grabs. Those who win will enjoy an MEPaposs salary of , Euros per year plus generous travel and office allowances - until Brexit happens, and theyaposre booted out of the Parliaement. So who is standing and who will you get to pick from in your area  Here are some of the big faces putting themselves forward, plus full lists of who is standing where. Scroll down for the full list by area.  On Thursday  May, millions of British voters will elect  MEPs to sit in the European Parliament - until Brexit happens. The elections were not meant to happen but have been forced on the UK after Theresa May agreed to delay Brexit until October . Voting is ided into large regions of the country, with each selecting between  and  MEPs using a form of proportional representation. Seats in each region are allotted to each party depending on what share of the regional vote they received. Sothe Tories win three seats in South East England, the highest three candidates on the Tory aposlistapos become MEPs. The actual aposDaposHondt systemapos for deciding which party gets which number of seats is very complicated. In each region, the party with the most votes gets the first seat then its total is ided by two and the party with the most votes in the second round gets the second seat. The process is repeated via a complex formula until all seats have been dished out. If youaposre into that sort of thing thereaposs a full explainer _EN.pdf" rel"nofollow"here. The Tories are expected to receive a hammering from Nigel Farageaposs Brexit Party, which has never faced an election before but contains many UKIP defector MEPs. Change UKwill be trying to scoop up the anti-Brexit vote in what is this groupaposs first ballot box test too. Those fringe movements could hit both Labour and the Tories hard, especially becausethe seats are chosen through a form of proportional representation, andEU elections were previously ripe for protest votes. In the last elections in , UKIP won  seats Labour won  the Tories won  and the Greens won . Nigel Farage will be leading the charge for his new Brexit Party, which despite only just setting up has enjoyed polling numbers in the mid-teens. Deputy Labour leader Tom Watson and Labour peer Maurice Glasman have warned the elite elite-basher poses a serious threat to Labour. He vowed to put the fear of God into our MPs - they deserve nothing less in comments that led to accusations he was making dog-whistle threats. Lord Buckethead The comedy character is back after becoming a viral internet sensation when he stood against Theresa May in . This time he is planning to stand against Nigel Farage in South East England.Because he is not part of a list he will need to outstrip the might of the big parties to get elected. But he has been boosted by more than £, in crowdfunding - three times what he needed for his £, deposit. Rachel Johnson Rachel Johnson, the sister of Tory Boris, is to stand for anti-Brexit party Change UK in the South West region. The journalist who has long campaigned against Brexit became the second sister of a prominent Brexiteer to join a new party in as many weeks. Jacob Rees-Moggaposs sister Annunziataalso announced she would stand in the election for Nigel Farageaposs Brexit Party. She took a swipe at her brother, saying she did not want to see Brexit “rubbing out my children’s prospects and chances of living and travelling and working in Europe”. Ann Widdecombe  Conservative Party stalwart Ann Widdecombe sensationally quit - to stand for the Brexit Party in the South West. The -year-old had been a staunch Tory for  years - serving as Shadow Health and Home secretary. But she has joined Nigel Farageaposs fledgling party on a mandate to hurry up and get Britain out of the EU. LGBT rights campaigners condemned theof Ms Widdecombe - who spent decades battling equal rights - just days after Nigel Farage claimed his new party would be intolerant of intolerance. The former Tory grandee voted against equalising the age of consent at , civil partnerships and the repeal of Section . And in  she defended gay conversion therapy - which Theresa May has branded abhorrent and vowed to ban.  Stephen Yaxley-Lennon announced he is standing to be an MEP in the forthcoming EU elections. The far-right extremist, who calls himself Tommy Robinson, launched his website on the final day of nominations to stand in the Europe-wide poll. Despite his role as an advisor to Ukip leader Gerard Batten, heaposs still barred from joining the party, and will stand in the North West region as an independent. In a message on the website, he took a swipe at Nigel Farage, calling him just another millionaire stockbroker who looks down at the working classes. He said he would fight against the Islamication of Britain and complained that the elites have tried to silence my own voice by jailing him for Contempt of Court and having his Facebook page removed. The former minister prompted raised eyebrows when he announced he would be standing for Labour - as second choice for the South West Region. The arch-Remain peer is most definitely not following Jeremy Corbynaposs official line on Brexit. He wants to cancel our leaving the EU - saying Brexit can and should be stopped. Carl Benjamin  The UKIP candidate refused to apologise for saying he wouldnapost even rape Labour MP Jess Phillips. The -year-old who styles himself aposSargon of Akkadapos even doubled down, saying his comments were justied because sheaposd been a giant bitch. In combative exchanges, Mr Benjamin - who is second on UKIPaposs South West regional list - told journalists: Iaposm not answering your questions, Iaposm not apologising for anything, you dirty, dirty smear merchants. Benjamin also repeatedly used the words n****r and spic in a since-deleted  video. The vlogger described two people as a fag and a retard and used an apparently anti-Semitic meme in the clip. And he said it was just f***ing fine to describe an Asian woman as a chink. The isive UKIP leader is almost guaranteed to re-win his seat as heaposs top of the partyaposs list in London. His leadership of the party has prompted an exodus of UKIP stalwarts including Nigel Farage, who said he was pushing it to the far right. He has courted far-right EDL founder Stephen Yaxley-Lennonand defended Carl Benjaminaposs claim he wouldnapost even rape a female MP. Laura Parker The left-winger - fourth on Labouraposs London list - is the most senior woman in the pro-Corbyn group Momentum. That means she is a power player in the partyaposs factional battle between a softer Brexit, none at all, or a second referendum. “If we were staring down the barrel of a no-deal gun, I personally would like to be asked what I thought about that,” she told the BBC last year. Eloise Todd Eyebrows were also raised when the chief of an anti-Brexit group was selected to run for Labour. Eloise Todd - the CEO of second referendum campaign group Best For Britain - will run as second on the list for Labour in Yorkshire and the Humber. Annunziata Rees-Mogg Jacob Rees-Moggaposs SISTER was announced as one of the first candidates for Nigel Farageaposs Brexit Party. Annunziata Rees-Mogg - a former Tory candidate who joined the Conservatives at the age of five - is a privately-educated fox hunting supporter once worked on the Brexiteer journal of Tory MP Bill Cash. The -year-old and her brother Jacob are both hard Brexiteers and were among five children of late newspaper editor William Rees-Mogg. She stood for the Tories aged just  in Aberavon, before falling out with the leadership when she stood again in Somerton and Frome in . David Cameron had suggested she refer to herself as aposNancy Moggapos - because her own name sounded too posh - but she refused. A YouTuber who was fined £ after filming a pug giving a Nazi salute is standing in the European elections for Ukip. Mark Meechan, , who styles himself as Count Dankula on the internet, said he would stand to represent Scotland in the EU. He was handed the fine for recording his girlfriendaposs pet dog, Buddha, responding to statements such as gas the Jews and Sieg Heil by raising its paw. He was found guilty of breaching the Communications Act by posting material that was grossly offensive and anti-Semitic and racist in nature, in an offence aggravated by religious prejudice, following a trial at Airdrie Sherf Court in April last year. He repeatedly refused to pay the fine but had the money seized from his bank account by court officials earlier this year.  Gavin EslerFormer BBC top dog Gavin Esler branded Brexit Britain a worldwide joke as he confirmed heaposll stand in the London region for Change UK. The former Royal Marines and Special Boat Service officer - who served three tours of Afghanistan - was revealed by Nigel Farage as the Brexit Partyaposs aposwar heroapos candidate. Ex-MP Katy Clark is a key ally of Jeremy Corbyn as the former political secretary to the Labour leader. She was shunted up to third place in the coveted London list for Labour MEP candidates after a reported battle between factions in the party. As an ally of Labouraposs leader she may introduce a sceptic note among other, far more wildly pro-EU candidates on the partyaposs list. His region doesnapost currently have a Green MEP but the party won almost % of the regional vote last time. story: NewsopinionStupid parents who dont vaccinate their children should go to jailThe anti-vax brigade kills youngsters just like drug dealers, speeding drivers and child abusersShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  APR Newsopinion"Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSo you didnapost get your child vaccinated  Fine. Your choice.Youaposll probably never see the people you killed and maimed.You wonapost meet the woman who never noticed a -day rubella rash, and then had a baby with a shrunken head, congenital cataracts, learning disabilities and diabetes. You wonapost learn the name of the -year-old boy who went deaf with the mumps, and died waiting for a new pancreas. You will never get to hear about the chemotherapy patients, HIV sufferers, and asthmatics whose immune systems couldnapost handle the measles virus, and who are reliant on you to help ensure % of humans are vaccinated in order to protect the rest. But the names of every single one of those you have harmed should be branded on your soul. You killed them, as surely asyou dealt drugs, drove too fast or beat a child so badly its small body could not withstand it.And just like every dealer, speeder and abuser, you knew what you were doing. The only dference is that you refused to look at your victims while you did it.Youaposve been told about Gareth Williams, who died of measles aged . You were warned about the  teenagers at Chichester High School who were diagnosed with the virus last year. You were sent leaflets, invited to appointments, and offered an alternative. You had the chance to learn about Nadja Petrovic, who was born with an auto-immune condition that was no risk to her le, but meant she could not have the jab. She died while being treated in hospital because another patient had measles, and the two were put in the same room by over-stretched hospital staff.Blood oozed from the toddleraposs nose and mouth before she died of heart failure. Because hereaposs the really awful thing: there is no cure for measles. Nothing. All you can do is give fluids, try to bring the fever down, and hope any secondary infection isnapost resistant to antibiotics. The best, and pretty much all, that you can do is to vaccinate people so the virus cannot find a host. If you donapost, measles lives to fight another day. Hereaposs Nadjaaposs mum Dragana holding her daughteraposs swollen, discoloured hand before she died, in a picture she made public to warn others of the risks. Just this week, we saw photos of Alba Moss, who has just turned one. She was too young for the vaccination but caught the disease because of other, stupid, abusive, parents. She spent eight days in hospital critically-ill, and when her mum Jilly posted the pictures as a warning these stupid, abusive idiots claimed Alba was a doll, that it was made up, that Jilly was being paid by some unseen, pro-vaccination lizard Illuminati.How the lizards benefit from healthy, happy children is unknown. But the anti-vax brigade seem to prefer them dead.Vaccinations exist because before we had them, measles killed .million people worldwide every year, mostly children under . They died in London and Manchester the same as they did in Tokyo and Timbuktu. The rate of mumps has dropped by % since vaccination began. There are still , children every year born with congenital rubella syndrome, because their mums were infected, but the bug is close to complete eradication in some places.The combined MMR vaccines have saved millions of lives, worldwide. Those countries where the diseases remain a serious problem are most likely to be in the developing world, where there is poor education, a lack of health infrastructure, and vaccinations only happenthe UN or WHO can get to you.Here in the UK, you have access to universal and higher education, a National Health Service free at the point of need, and a well-resourced GP covering every town and village. And  MILLION parents have decided to ignore all that.Yesterday Tory Health Secretary Matt Half-cocked was asked what heaposs going to do about the fact UNICEF says , children in the UK have not been vaccinated against measles. He blamed social media, that go-to Tory evasion-tactic for any minister who cannot express complicated thoughts.And algorithms had a role in the spread of anti-vax propaganda - social media becomes a positive feedback loop for any mad thought people express, while unwelcome facts that donapost fit the fiction are scrubbed from their timelines. But thereaposs more to it. Tory austerity has led to the closure of an estimated , childrenaposs centres, community hubs where vaccines could both be explained and administered. Government health campaigns are under-funded and under-noticed, compared to previous ones. And there is so much instruction about what to do, what to eat and how to do things that the important stuff can get lost under an onslaught of less wine, more blueberries, high-fat, low-carb, fun-free and unbalanced balderdash from aposexpertsapos who arenapost.So boil this down to basics. A million parents are hurting their children, other peopleaposs children, and adults, in this country and, thanks to international travel, around the world. Were they paedophiles, theyaposd be hunted down by Interpol. Were they county lines dealers, theyaposd be tracked by the National Crime Agency. If they were hurtling around the place in -wheel artics, the police would be laying out stingers to shred their tyres.Theyaposd be brought to justice. Asked about banning unvaccinated children from schools, as has been tried in France and the US, the minister said: I donapost think weaposre there yet.In  there were zero deaths in the UK from measles. A year later, disgraced doctor Andrew Wakefield made bogus claims about the measles vaccine. In the years since, there have been a total of  deaths from measles. One was a baby, one a toddler, and the others were all aged  or older.Over the same period another , Britons were infected, with massive health and social costs of dealing with the likely complications which can include pneumonia, meningitis, bronchitis, eye ulcers and permanent brain damage.One dead baby would be enough for some, but  corpses and many millions of pounds of expense is probably enough to convince most voters that something needs to be done. Especially as it was easily, and cheaply, avoidable.The real crime is people CHOSE to make this happen. People who claim to love their children, people who most likely have comfortable, middle-class lestyles, and smugly feel that a pension, mortgage and SUV make their family immune to the sort of disease that slaughters poorer children indiscriminatelythey are not helped.Itaposs people who pay attention to aposcelebrityapos influencers, first-time parents who listen to other idiots at their private ante-natal class rather than their doctor, those who think aposooh, well, itaposs a lot to give a tiny baby all at once and doesnapost the vaccine have metal in it, too aposThey donapost stop to ask themselves how, exactly, theyaposd continue to breathe in and out without iron, zinc, chromium and copper, or whether their blood system would work better or worse without the tiny amounts of gold in it.Despite the high levels of stupid at work here, most of these people have access to the facts. Most know measles is bad, eventhey are so far removed from any instance of it theyaposve no idea how it terried their grandmothers. But they have nevertheless made a conscious decision to do something which makes their children vulnerable to a deadly, awful disease, and invited it to happen to others.In law, it is illegal not just to deal drugs, to speed or to assault, but also to accidentally kill as a result. Itaposs called manslaughter. And thataposs why every parent who refuses to vaccinate their child against any one of the host of childhood diseases that can kill them should be arrested, charged, and put on trial for child abuse. They are wilfully inflicting pain, they are negligently inviting risk, they are intentionally undertaking an act they know, with a secondaposs pause, is likely to hurt someone other than themselves.Because most of these parents were vaccinated. Most of them were given access to everything their parents and grandparents  in many cases didnapost have, like further education, careers, and pensions. Their forebears knew what measles was, and shielded their descendants from it these new, stupid parents are not afraid of a monster they have never seen. They have never seen it in their families, in their newsfeeds, or in government information campaigns. Most of them have never seen an amputation without anaesthetic, either, but they still know itaposs not a great idea. Theyaposd know that not vaccinating children was bad, too,it carried a prison sentence. Those given the chance to improve the world, and who choose instead to maim and kill, should have their children, and their liberty, removed.

Carl Benjamin - who calls himself Sargon of Akkad - repeatedly used the words n****r and spic in a since-deleted  video. The vlogger also repeatedly described two people as a fag and a retard and used an apparently anti-Semitic meme in the clip. And he said it was just f***ing fine to describe an Asian woman as a chink. Anti-fascist group HOPE not Hate, which obtained the video, said the appalling slurs showed the mask has slipped.And Labour MP David Lammy said: This is an ideology of hate. It must be confronted and defeated.Yet today an apparently unrepentant Benjamin said people who had been offended can go and have a cry. And UKIP defended Benjamin as a YouTube entertainer fighting political correctness - before telling the Mirror: He will remain on the UKIP ticket.”    It comes days after UKIPaposs leader defended Benjamin, who is standing for the South West region in the May  European Parliament elections, for saying he wouldnapost even rape a female MP. Challenged about the comment earlier this month, Benjamin said: I think we should treat women the same as men. That meansa woman is being a giant bitch and laughing at male suicide, Iaposm going to be a giant dick back to her. The video, a copy of which has been watched by the Mirror, opened with a black man telling the camera: It’s not acceptable to call me a n****r. Benjaminaposs voice then cut in, saying: Why would you begin our conversation like that  It kind of makes me think that you want the internet to open up with a big bunch of memes on your ass, calling you a n****r. It’s not personal, no one really thinks you’re a n****r, it’s just that you’ve turned around and said aposIt’s not acceptable to call me a n****rapos and then no one fucking knows you dude.    You’re wearing a suit and tie, no one thinks you’re like some gangster or anything. Later text reading gay n****rs from outer space appeared, with Benjaminaposs voice continuing: If you hadn’t provoked me,you had just kept your whore mouth shut, I wouldn’t be putting [up this] picture. An Hispanic woman then told the video: It’s not acceptable to call me a spic.Benjaminaposs voice could be heard saying: Yeah okay, but it’s not like I’m walking   down the aisles of my local grocery   store and I see a spic, and go aposHey spic!   Hey spic!apos You know, I don’t know you, I,   I don’t really want to talk to you, I don’t   need to get your attention by calling you a spic. I don’t even know why you   would bring this up, what’s, what’s the   deal. But anyway, as, as with the previous   guy,   I won’t call him a n****r, and I won’t   call you a spic. That’s what I agree to. When an Asian woman said she shouldnapost be called a chink, Benjaminaposs voice could be heard saying: Aha! Ha ha ha, ha ha ha! Ha ha ha! You lose! It’s actually fine! It’s actually just f***ing fine and I’ll tell you why. Because Asians are privileged. In almost every walk of le, Asians make more money, they have better results, and they do better in le than me, just a dumb ass cracker. So, when Asians are filling up all of those top spots in better proportion than white people, you have to understand you have institutional privilege over me, I mean you’re using your s to lecture me now. So f*** off chink, it’s okay for me to call you this, because racism is power plus prejudice.  Later in the video Benjaminaposs voice told someone: Oh f*** off you fag. That’s not racial discrimination, that’s not even sexual discrimination, that’s just you being a f***ing fag. I don’t even care, I don’t even know that you’re gay, you might not be gay, but you’re still a fag. Shut up, f*** off. And when a man appeared saying It’s not acceptable to call me a kike, Benjaminaposs voice could be heard saying: I totally agree. Absolutely unacceptable. How dare you. Over the image, however, were overlaid what appear to be clearly anti-Semitic images of large-nosed people rubbing their hands with glee.  Later, comments in Benjaminaposs voice addressed to a woman with Downaposs syndrome said: You know what, fair enough, you can’t change that you’re a retard, and it’s not very nice for me to call your retard. I won’t do it. Nick Lowles, chief executive of HOPE not hate, said: “These appalling slurs show the mask slipping from Carl Benjamin, a man who likes to hide behind his YouTube personna and write off everything as a joke or as part of a free speech mantle. “Even a far-right party like UKIP and its Muslim-obsessed leader Gerard Batten must realise they’ve made a horrendous error in selecting Benjamin as a candidate. They must now immediately sack him, or forever be seen to be siding with bigotry, homophobia, misogyny and racism. The voters of the South West deserve better than this. A UKIP spokesman told the Mirror today: Carl Benjamin is a free speech campaigner who is challenging the gatekeepers of political correctness. “Mr Benjamin’s background as a YouTube entertainer should not, and will not exclude him from candidacy. Mr Benjamin will remain on the UKIP ticket.”The right-winger appeared unrepentant over the video, which was originally reported by BuzzFeed News.A statement to BuzzFeed said: “BREAKING NEWS: Anti-political correctness entertainer has used naughty words for fun. Subscribe to Buzzfeed for more hard-hitting and worthwhile political activism. “I expect my statement to be printed in full, have a great day.”He told Sky News: Iaposm not really interested in discussing any of these comments because, you see, Iaposve had something like  million views on my YouTube channels in total.Iaposve got a huge audience. If people want to go see them they can go watch them on my channel and see the context of them for themselves. Told people had been offended he said: I tell you what. They can go and have a cry, and when theyaposve collected themselves and theyaposre ready to talk like an adult about the issues and not bring up things that they think might be offensive and spread them around the country to people who might be offended by them, then we can have a sensible conversation about the issues.

story: NewsBeaver toddler with rare condition needs new cot after eating her wooden oneLittle Ruby Smith suffers from a rare condition know as pica which compels her to eat household items, including her special wooden cotShareCommentsByNeil Murphy:,  APR Updated:,  APR NewsRuby has already been to hospital dozens of times over her seizures "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailParents of a aposbeaverapos toddler who has eaten doormats, gravel and even bit the family cat are fundraising for a special cot - after she ate her wooden one.Little Ruby Smith suffers from an ultra-rare neurological condition that causes epilepsy , paralysis and also pica, a condition which compels her to eat non-food items.Mum Claire Parsons has been forced to remove many ordinary household items from their living room including books, CDs and DVDs - because Ruby will try to eat them. The curious tot is also banned from being in the garden and kitchen on her own because she has eaten gravel, grass and cat food in the past. The poor toddler almost choked to death when she bit a chunk out of a doormat and dad Sam Smith saved her le.    Pictures show Rubyaposs traditional cotaposs wooden sides chewed asan animal has been gnawing it. Claire, from Bedford, Bedfordshire, said: Sheaposs always got something in her mouth - even the cat [Steve]! Sheaposs like a little beaver. If she can get her hands on it she will eat it. The wooden bar [of her cot] has been chewed down over a few months. I have to be careful what I cover it with so she canapost chew that either. Thereaposs nothing in our living room for her to get hold of - no books, no DVDs, nothing that she could rip up and chew.    We canapost let her out in the garden because she would eat it. Sheaposd eat the gravel and the grass. She enjoys the trampoline but we canapost let her have free rein. We canapost let her into the kitchen because thereaposs cat food and sheaposll eat it. It can be very dangerous. Children with her condition are prone to choking due to the paralysis and low muscle tone. Paper is one of her favourite - like on video games cases. So we donapost keep those anymore or CD cases. She has tried to eat grass and gravel in the past.    We had one of the furry doormats too and she choked - she took a big chunk out of it. Her dad [cable engineer Sam, ] saved her le - I was about to ring an ambulance. This was around  months old and since then weaposve been very careful about what we have around. My son loves Rubix cubes and he canapost have those in the living room because she has tried biting one of those before and a piece of it came off. She doesnapost understand any dangers. Ruby has alternating hemiplegia of childhood- an ultra-rare neurological condition that causes epilepsy, paralysis, low muscle tone, cerebral palsy and uncontrollable body movements. The brave little girl was first diagnosed with AHC in  after repeated visits to Bedford Hospital for genetic testing. At just five days old she started having seizures and would be rushed to hospital aposthree or four times a weekapos. Claire said: Ruby was born by emergency cesarean and started having seizures at about five days old. We thought she was just poorly and had picked something up. In the end, we were going to hospital around three or four times a week. Now she has absent seizures every day, but we have to call an ambulance out two or three times a month. Sheaposll be bluelighted in. She can be playing and become paralysed all of a sudden. She has uncontrolled epilepsy and is always chewing because sheaposs got pica. She turns four next week but her mental age is around  months. Some of it is sensory. When youaposre a baby you chew things, lick them, itaposs just a phase - but sheaposs still doing it. Luckily her teeth are lovely for now.  Rubyaposs crowdfunding page has so far raised £ towards her £, target since it launched earlier this month - but she has quite a way to go. The bed, which will be made by a specialist firm, will include teething-safe plastic so she wonapost be able to chomp her way through it. Claire said: Ruby doesnapost just need a hospital bed. To keep her safe we need something specially built for her that she cannot eat. Because itaposs a special needs requirement itaposs more expensive and we need to fund that ourselves. The bed itself will cost £,. Weaposre having it made from Andersonaposs Themes and Dreams who make bespoke, special needs beds. Iaposve told them specically what we need and they can fit teething plastic on the bars. Itaposs made of wood but they put a clear softened plastic on there to stop her chewing it - all bars, all top rails. This bed will be a safe space for her. Itaposs just part of who she is. We need to keep her safe from choking because thataposs whataposs most important.You can donate to Rubyaposs cause here -  https:www.justgiving crowdfunding rubymeahc

title: dark past monster worcester who
story: NewsDark past of Monster of Worcester who killed  children and impaled them on a fenceDavid McGreavy murdered Samantha, Dawn and Paul in  and is now set to be released from prisonShareCommentsByJane Lavender:,  APR NewsDavid McGreavy was jailed for le for the killings "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email It was a crime so gruesome it rocked the nation and devastated a happy home. The brutal slaughter of three young children in their own house by a man they should have been able to trust. David McGreavy slaughtered eight month old baby Samantha, Dawn, two, and David, four, at their home in Worcester in .When their father, Clive Ralph, left them in the care of the man who he had welcomed into the family home as a lodger, the three were sleeping peacefully in bed. McGreavy was known for his affection for children, especially those he shared a home with, so the decision to leave him in charge of them was a simple one.    But when Clive ed from collecting their mother, Elsie, from work the house was a blood bath and his children had been murdered by the man who was supposed to be protected them. There was no sign of McGreavy or the children. Aged just , McGreavy had flown into a drunken rage because baby Samantha started crying for her bottle. He strangled her with his hands and she eventually died from a fracture to her skull. McGreavy then turned his murderous intention to the other youngsters. He slit two-year-old Dawnaposs throat and strangled Paul, four, with a wire.  After the violent murders he then mutilated their tiny bodies with a pickaxe and impaled them on a neighbouraposs fence. It earned him the chilling nickname the aposMonster of Worcesterapos and McGreavy was jailed for  years for the brutal crime. Aged just  at the time of the killings, no one could have predicted the terrying events of that night. The childrensapos mother even claimed McGreavy was like a father to the trio and he had been known to criticise her when she disciplined Paul. McGreavy had moved into the family home when Elsie was pregnant with her youngest daughter. He immediately became a much-loved part of the family, often cooking Sunday dinner and babysitting for the three children.  His crime stunned the nation - how could a man who adored the children he was living with subject them to such horror  McGreavyaposs family were also baffled. His father, Tom McGreavy, said: Everyone who knew David knew that he loved children. But the affable young man who had become a key part of family le for the Ralphaposs was hiding a dark past. Born in Southport in , he was the second oldest of six children and spent much of his childhood moving between army bases as his father was a sergeant in the army. His early le pushed him to pursue a career in the Armed Forces and by  he had quit school and enlisted in the Navy.  In the late sixties, and stationed in Portsmouth, McGreavy joined his first ship, HMS Eagle. Described by colleagues as a arrogant young man and cocky McGreavy found himself subject to several disciplinary procedures. But then he started drinking and his career began to unravel. While working as a steward in the mess hall he spotted his name had been written in a Chief Petty Officeraposs Book. Worried this could mean he was about to be told he was changing jobs he reached for booze. Criminologist Dr Elizabeth Yardley said: He actually broke into an officeraposs ward room and set fire to a bin that had papers in it.  He said he did this mistakenly, by accidentally dropping a cigarette end, and he did raise the alarm at :am. He expected the Navy to believe he was just an innocent eye witness, they saw beyond that and he was court marshalled. He was found guilty of negligence and sentenced to  days detention. By  he had fallen in love with a woman called Mary, who he proposed to just one week after meeting her for the first time. In the same year his career in the Navy had collapsed and he was dismisssed and he was forced tohome to his parents. A series of jobs followed, from chef to labourer, but they all eneded the same way - he was sacked.  His attitude, arrogance and alcohol were all cited as reasons. McGreavy now put all his focus on his upcoming marriage to Mary - and he wanted a huge white wedding with all the trimmings. But on New Yearaposs Eve  Mary ended the engagement, leaving McGreavy devasated. Depressed and sulking while living with his parents, McGreavy moved into with his school friend, Clive Ralph. Cliveaposs decision to allow him to lodge with his family would have devastating consequences. The father had married Elsie when she was just  and pregnant with their first child and worked hard as a lorry driver to provide for his growing family. Living conditions in the two-bed house were cramped.  McGreavy shared a bed with little Paul while baby Samantha was in a cradle cot in her parentsapos room and Dawn slept in a bed next to her mum and dad. Cliveaposs lorry driving job meant he was regularly away from home and Elsie was grateful for McGreavyaposs help in caring for the children and running the home. A genial man who was adored by the family and liked by those who knew him, once again his personality completely changed whe he drank. McGreavy was arrested several times for being drunk in public and his father warned him to stop. But his refusal to listen cost three young children their lives. With Sri Lanka a popular honeymoon destination, many couples, who had booked for post-wedding holidays in the coming weeks, have been forced to make alternative arrangements.    Abigail McKie, a specialist support worker from Doncaster, was due to travel to the country for a honeymoon in June with her fiance Alisdair Smith, but they are facing the prospect of rearranging the entire trip. Iaposve cried quite a few times already, she said. Itaposs so frustrating. Weaposve booked our train tickets and weaposve got our visas. Itaposs all booked, itaposs all paid for. The couple had saved up £, for a tour of Sri Lanka, with stops including Colombo, Kandy and the countryaposs Cultural Triangle, with a particular focus on seeing wildle. Weaposre quite adventurous and we donapost like staying in one place, the -year-old said.    She said her travel agent is now advising the couple change the destination for the trip, which they had been planning for around a year.Theyaposve given us a few options like Borneo but to be honest we were so set on Sri Lanka, she said.Despite her frustration with the situation, she said she understood why the Foreign Office had changed its advice.Theyaposre just trying to keep everyone safe and honestly my heart goes out to anyone thataposs out there already or that was meant to be going sooner than we are, she said. Theyaposve probably done the right thing but itaposs hard to take. Amy Goodman, a doctor from Armagh, Northern IReland, had been due to stay at Colomboaposs Cinnamon Grand hotel, one of the sites that was hit in the bombings, with her fiance Ross Kernan as part of their honeymoon in June.    They are now working with their travel agent to cut Sri Lanka out of their itinerary completely. Ms Goodman, , said: Just the thought that we could have been there... If you see the hotel you were meant to spend the first few weeks of your married le in blown to pieces, it just wouldnapost have felt right. It made us feel quite uneasy to go to another country where a government has stipulated that there is a threat and that there could be another attack at any time. Ms Goodman and her fiance had been planning the trip for over two years, and she had taken on extra shts at the hospital where she works to pay for the holiday.  But she said they were some of the lucky ones as they were able to rearrange with a manageable surcharge, and that they had been planning on changing their plans even before the new Foreign Office advice. She said: It just wouldnapost have felt right - the eeriness, and of course the tragedy for the Sri Lankans as well, we felt we couldnapost do it. Travel trade organisation Abta said those booked to travel on a package holiday imminently would be offered the chance to postpone their trip, rearrange to an alternative destination or receive a refund. Those who booked flights and accommodation separately were advised to talk to the inidual companies or check with their insurers.

The footage shows a fireball rising from the Port Talbot facility, in Wales, lighting up the night sky in the early hours of this morning. Neighbours described a big ball of flame, followed by a massive mushroom of smoke after hearing three deafening bangs.  Bosses at the steelworks plant say two workers were left slightly injured. Eyewitness Lance Davies lives at the highest point in the town and said it was a miracle no-one was killed. He said: I was woken up this morning by what sounded like thunder, I went to the window and could see the results of the first explosion, then I called my partner and saw the other two. The blasts took place at around .am this morning. A Tata Steel spokesman said: We can confirm two of our employees were slightly injured when there was a spillage of liquid iron while it was travelling to the steel plant.  All fires have now been extinguished. A full investigation has begun. The site had reopened by am and sht workers were spotted arriving for work as usual. Explosions were heard  miles away in Bridgend, South Wales. The steelworks is the largest in the UK and employs more than , people. It was threatened with closure in  when it was put up for sale by Tata. However bosses changed their minds after workers agreed to a change in their pension deals. South Wales Police said: Emergency services remain on scene but we have had confirmation that all members of staff are accounted for and there are only two casualties with minor injuries. Early indications are that the seat of the explosion was a train which carries molton metal into the works.    The explosion caused some small fires which are all under control and damage to some buildings on the site. South West Fire and Rescue Service say there are no concerns over hazardous effects from smoke from the fire. Aberavon MP Stephen Kinnock said the incident raised real concerns about safety at the works. He said: It could have been a lot worse.
